I am here to work to solve problems. And to say we will drop spending levels up to 30 percent, but provide no specifics, is being less then genuine. As Colin Powell recently said, I'm very put off when people just say let's go back and freeze to the level two years ago. Tell me what you're going to cut, and nobody up there yet is being very, very candid about what they are going to cut to fix this problem. The public has been very clear. Along with the continued rise of Facebook and Twitter, InformationWeek notes: He is stepping aside just as Google spins the wheel on its riskiest bet yet: the launch of Chrome OS, the company's Web-based operating system.
